title: Houses in Fin-de-Siècle Britain: The Interior in Fin-de-Siècle Britain
excerpt: Middle class families, like their upper-class peers, took the interior of their houses very seriously. It was the primary means with which they could put their financial and social status on display for the world to see. As such, interior design was arguably the quickest developing part of the house which continually morphed into different styles.
